Oct   Philadelphia Pennsylvania USA Washington Commanders defensive end Montez Sweat  on the field against the Philadelphia Eagles at Lincoln Financial Field PERIOD Mandatory Credit Eric HartlineUSA TODAY Sports

The Chicago Bears are acquiring Washington Commanders defensive end Montez Sweat from the Washington Commanders in exchange for a secondround pick in the  NFL Draft according to multiple reports PERIOD

Sweat  has recorded . sacks in eight games this season and is one of seven players with at least . sacks in each of the past five seasons PERIOD

By comparison the Bears have a leaguelow  sacks in  PERIOD

Sweat has . sacks in his career and is in the final season of his contract PERIOD The Bears have enough salarycap space to offer Sweat a longterm deal or use the franchise tag. pERIOD

Part of the motive for the Commanders to make a trade is the cap crunch surrounding their haul of firstround picks invested in the position PERIOD Washington signed defensive tackle Jonathan Allen to a fouryear  million extension and his interior linemate Daron Payne to a fouryear  million contract PERIOD Even with Sweat gone the Commanders still have a decision to make on former No PERIOD  overall pick Chase Young who is in a contract year PERIOD

Sweat has collected  tackles and two forced fumbles this season PERIOD

He has  tackles and nine forced fumbles since being selected by Washington with the twenty-sixth overall pick of the  NFL Draft PERIOD
